Iâ€™m encountering an issue with a blocking action in a workflow. The action sends selected properties to a Lambda function, which then triggers a worker code that updates certain contact fields.
The workflow should remain blocked until it receives a response from the worker code, confirming that the contact fields have been updated. However, the action is marked as "succeeded" immediately after the Lambda function sends a response, which isn't the intended behavior.
Is there a way to make the workflow wait for the worker code's response before it ends, rather than succeeding right after the Lambda function sends a response?

Is the "block" action execution response missing a <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions#:~:text=you%20can%20specify%20a%20value%20for%20the%20hs_default_expiration%20field|hs_default_expiration> specification?
> When blocking, you can specify a value for the `hs_default_expiration` field, after which your custom action will be considered expired. The execution of the workflow will then resume and the action following your custom action will be executed, _*even if the action is not completed.*_

I have specified the expiration duration time..but since i get the response from lambda function the action is completed..but i need the action to wait for the response from the worker code after processing
